Type.Name: UriBuilder

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UriBuilder extends System.Object

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Provides a mutable version of the class.

remarks.para: The and classes both represent a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). Instances of the type are immutable: once the underlying URI is specified, neither it nor its components, or constituent parts, can be changed. The type permits modifications to the components of the URI it represents. The property provides the current contents of a as a instance.

para.block: For more information on URI, see IETF RFC 2396.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Fragment { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_Fragment() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_Fragment(string value) }
public string Fragment { get; set; }
.property instance string Fragment

summary.para: Gets or sets the fragment component of the current instance.

value.para: A containing the fragment component of the URI represented by the current instance.

Docs.remarks: The property contains any text following a fragment marker ('#') in the URI, including the marker itself. When setting the property, the property value does not include the fragment marker as it is added to the property value by the set operation. Specifying for the property value sets the property to . If or are specified in a set operation, the fragment marker is not added to the property value. The set operation does not escape the fragment value. Setting the property to any value, including , sets the property to .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual int32 GetHashCode()
public override int GetHashCode ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

summary.para: Generates a hash code for the current instance.

returns.para: A containing the hash code for this instance.

remarks.para: The hash code is generated without the fragment component. For example, the URIs "http://www.contoso.com/index.htm#search" and "http://www.contoso.com/index.htm" produce the same hash code.
The algorithm used to generate the hash code is unspecified.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Path { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_Path() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_Path(string value) }
public string Path { get; set; }
.property instance string Path

summary.para: Gets or sets the path to the resource represented by the current instance.

value.para: A containing the path to the resource represented by the current instance.

remarks.para: This property returns the escaped form of the path information in the current instance. Values specified for set operations are escaped, and any backslashes are converted to forward slashes.
Specifying or for a set operation sets this property to "/" .

MemberSignature.Value: .property int32 Port { public hidebysig specialname instance int32 get_Port() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_Port(int32 value) }
public int Port { get; set; }
.property instance int32 Port

summary.para: Gets or sets the port number used to connect to the referenced by the current instance.

value.para: A containing a non-negative port number or -1.

remarks.para: If no port was specified, the property returns the default port as determined by the scheme of the current instance. A port value of -1 indicates that the current scheme does not use a port, as is the case when the scheme of the current instance is the scheme.

para.block: For the list of default ports used with each scheme, see .

Docs.exception: The value specified for a set operation was less than zero.

public string Query { get; set; }
.property instance string Query

summary.para: Gets or sets the query component of the current instance.

value.para: A containing the query component of the URI represented by the current instance.

Docs.remarks: The property contains any text following a query marker ('?') in the URI, including the marker itself. When setting the property, the property value does not include the query marker as it is added to the property value by the set operation. Specifying for the property value sets the property to . If or are specified in a set operation, the query marker is not added to the property value. The set operation does not escape the query value. Setting the property to any value, including , sets the property to .

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Scheme { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_Scheme() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_Scheme(string value) }
public string Scheme { get; set; }
.property instance string Scheme

summary.para: Gets or sets the scheme component of the current instance.

value.para: A containing the scheme component of the current instance.

remarks.para: Specifying for a set operation sets this property to . If the value specified for a set operation contains a colon (":"), the scheme is set using the substring that includes all characters from the start of the value up to, but not including the colon. The characters in the value are converted to lower case.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual string ToString()
public override string ToString ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

summary.para: Returns the escaped form of the URI represented by the current instance.

returns.para: A containing the escaped URI contained in the current instance.

remarks.para: The string returned by this method (shown here as uriString) is constructed as follows:

c.para: If port != -1 and host != "", then uriString = uriString + ":" + port.
If host != "" and path != "" and path != "/", then uriString = uriString + "/".
If fragment != "", then uriString = uriString + fragment, else uriString = uriString + query.

MemberSignature.Value: .property class System.Uri Uri { public hidebysig specialname instance class System.Uri get_Uri() }
public Uri Uri { get; }
.property instance class System.Uri Uri

summary.para: Gets a instance constructed using the current instance.

value.para: A containing the URI components of the current instance.

remarks.para: This property returns the same instance until modifications are made to the current instance, at which time a new instance is constructed by passing the string representation of the current instance to the ( ) constructor.

Docs.exception: The URI constructed using the string representation of the current instance is in an invalid form.
